t: ON angynne gesceop God heofonan & eorðan.
Se eorðe soðlice wæs idel & æmti, & þeostra wæron oferðære nywelnysse bradnysse; & Godes gast wæsgeferod ofer wæteru.
God cwæð ða: Gewurðe leoht, & leoht wæarð geworht.
God geseah ða ðæt hit god wæs, & he todældeto dældontodældonleoht fram ðam ðystrum.
& het ðæt leoht dæg & þa ðystru niht: ða wæs gewordenæfen & merigen an dæg.
God cwæð ða eft: Gewurðe nu fæstnys tomiddes ðamwæterum & totwæme ða wæteru fram ðam wæterum.
& God geworhte ða fæstnysse, & totwæmde ða wæteru, ðawæron under ðære fæstnysse, fram ðam ðe wæronbufan ðære fæstnysse: hit wæs ða swa gedon.
& God het ða fæstnysse heofonan, & wæs ða geworden æfen& mergen oðer dæg.
God ða soðlice cwæð: Beon gegaderode ða wæteru ðe syndunder ðære heofonan & æteowige drignys; Hitwæs ða swa gedon.
& God gecygde ða drignysse eorðan & ðæra wæteragegaderunga he het sæ. God geseah ða ðæt hit godwæs.
& he cwæð: Sprytte seo eorðe growende gærs & sædwyrcende & æppelbære treow wæstm wyrcende æfterhis cynne, ðæs sæd sy on him syluum ofer eorðan; Hit wæsða swa gedon.
& seo eorðe forðteah growende wyrta & sæd berende be hyrecynne & treow wæstm wyrcende & gehwilcsæd hæbbende æfter his hiwe; God geseah ða ðæt hit godwæs.
& wæs geworden æfen & mergen se ðridda dæg.
God cwæð ða soðlice: Beo nu leoht on ðære heofenanfæstnysse, & todælan dæg & nihte, & beon to tacnum& to tidum & to dagum & to gearum.
& hi scinon on ðære heofenan fæstnysse & alihton ðaeorðan; Hit wæs ða swa geworden.
& God geworhte twa micele leoht, þæt mare leoht to ðæsdæges lihtinge, & ðæt læsse leoht to ðærenihte lihtinge, & steorran he geworhte.
& gesette hi on ðære heofenan, ðæt hi scinon ofereorðan.
& gymdon ðæs dæges & ðære nihte &todældonleoht &ðystro; God geseah ða þæt hit god wæs.
& wæs geworden æfen & mergen se feorða dæg.
God cwæð eac swylce: Teon nu ða wæteru forð swymmendecynn cucu on life & fleogende cynn ofereorðan under þære heofonan fæstnysse.
& God gesceop ða ða miclan hwalas & eal lybbende fisccyn &styrigendlice, ðe ða wæteru tugon forðon heora hiwum, & eall fleogende cyn æfter heora cynne; Godgeseah ða ðæt hit god wæs.
& bletsode hi, ðus cweðende: Weaxað & beoð gemænifylde,& gefyllað ðære sæ wæteru, & ða fugelasbeon gemænifylde ofer eorðan.
& ða wæs geworden æfen & merigen se fifta dæg.
God cwæð eac swilce: Læde seo eorðe forð cuce nytena onheora cynne & creopende cyn & deor æfterheora hiwum; Hit wæs ða swa gedon.
& God ða geworhte ðære eorðan deor æfter heora hiwum &ða nytenu & eall creopende cynn on heoracynne; God geseah ða ðæt hit god wæs.
& cwæð: Vton wyrcan man to anlicnysse & to ure gelicnysse,& he sy ofer ða fixas & ofer ðafugelas & ofer ða deor & ofer ealle gesceafta & ofer eallecreopende, ðe styriað on eorðan.
God gesceop ða man to his anlicnysse, to Godes anlicnyssehe gesceop hine; werhades & wifhades hegesceop hi.
& God hi bletsode, & cwæð: Weaxað & beoð gemenifylde &gefyllað ða eorðan & gewyldað hi, & habbaðon eowrum gewealde ðære sæ fixas & ðære lyfte fugelas &ealle nytenu, ðe styriað ofer eorðan.
God cwæð ða: Efne ic forgyfe eow eall gærs & wyrta sædberende ofer eorðan & ealle treowa, ða ðehabbað sæd on him sylfum heora agenes cynnes, ðæt hi beoneow to mete.
& eallum nytenum & eallum fugelcynne & eallum ðam ðestyriað on eorðan, on ðam ðe is libbendelif, ðæt hi habbon him to gereordigenne; Hit wæs ða swagedon.
& God geseah ealle ða ðingc ðe he geworhte & hi wæronswyðe gode; Wæs ða geworden æfen & meriense sixta dæg.
EORNOSTLICE ða wæron fulfremode heofonas & eorðe & eallheora frætewung.
& God ða gefylde on ðone seofoðan dæg his weorc ðe heworhte. & he gereste hine on ðone seofoðan dæg fram eallumðam weorcum ðe he gefremode.
& God gebletsode ðone seofoðan dæg & hine gehalgode, forðan ðe he on ðone dæg geswac hisweorces, ðe he gesceop to wyrcenne.
ðas synd ðæra heofenan & ðæra eorðan cneornysse, ðaða hi gesceapene wæron on ðam dæge ðe Godgeworhte heofonan & eorðan.

& ælcne telgor on eorðan, ær ðan ðe he up asprunge oneorðan, & eall gærs & wyrta ealles eardes,ær ðan ðe hi up asprytton; God soðlice ne sende nænneren ofer eorðan ða gyt: & mann næs, ðe ðaeorðan worhte.
Ac an wyl asprang of ðære eorðan wæterigende ealle ðæreeorðan bradnysse.
God gesceop eornostlice man of ðære eorðan lame, & onableow on his ansyne lifes orðunge, & seman wæs geworht on libbendre sawle.
God ða aplantode wynsumne orcerd fram frymðe, on ðam hegelogode þone man ðe he geworhte.
God ða forð ateah of ðære moldan ælces cynnes treow,fæger on gesyhðe & to brucenne wynsum, eacswylce lifes treow on middan neorxnawange and treow ingehydesgodes & yfeles.
& ðæt flod eode of stowe to stowe ðære wynsumnysse towæterigenne neorxnawang; ðæt flod is ðanontodæled on feower ean.
An ea of ðam hatte Fison; seo gæð onbutan ðæt land ðeis gehaten Euilað, ðær ðær gold wyxð.
& ðæs landes gold is golda selost; ðær beoð eac gemetteða gimstanas dellium & honynchinus.
ðære oðre ea nama is Gion; seo is eac gehaten Nilus: seoymbgæð eall ðæra Silhearwena land.
þære ðriddan ea nama is Tygris; seo gæð ongean ðaAssyriscan; Seo feorðe ea is gehaten Eufrates.
God genam ða ðone man & gelogode hine on neorxnawange,ðæt he ðær wyrcean sceolde &to dældontodældonbegyman.
& bebead him, ðus cweðende: Of ælcum treowe ðisesorcerdes ðu most etan.
Soðlice of ðam treowe ingehydes godes & yfeles ne et ðu;on swa hwylcum dæge swa ðu etst of ðamtreowe, ðu scealt deaðe sweltan.
God cwæð eac swylce: Nis na god ðisum men ana towunigenne; uton wyrcean him sumne fultum to hisgelicnysse.
God soðlice gelædde ða nytenu, ðe he of eorðan gesceop,& ðære lyfte fugelas to Adame, ðæt heforesceawode hu he hi gecygde; Soðlice ælc libbende nyten,swa swa Adam hit gecygde, swa is his nama.
& Adam ða genamode ealle nytenu heora naman, & ealle fugelas& ealle wildeor; Adam soðlice negemette ða gyt nanne fultume his gelican.
ða sende God slæp on Adam, & ða ða he slep, ða genam hean rib of his sidan, & gefylde mid flæsceðær ðæt rib wæs.
& geworhte ðæt rib, ðe he genam of Adame, to anum wifmen& gelædde hi to Adame.
Adam ða cwæð: ðis is nu ban of minum banum & flæsc ofminum flæsce; beo heo geciged fæmne, forðan ðe heo is of hyre were genumen.
For ðan forlæt se man fæder & modor, & geðeot hine to hiswife, & hi beoð buta on anum flæsce.
Hi wæron ða buta, Adam & his wif, nacode & him ðæs nesceamode.
EAC swylce seo næddre wæs geapre ðonne ealle ða oðrenytenu ðe God geworhte ofer eorðan; & seonæddre cwæð to ðam wife: Hwi forbead God eow ðæt ge neæton of ælcon treowe binnan Paradisum?
þæt wif andwyrde: Of ðæra treowa wæstme ðe synd onParadisum we etað.
& of ðæs treowes wæstme þe is on middan neorxnawange,God bebead us, ðæt we ne æton, ne we ðættreow neto dældontodældonði læs ðe we swelton.
ða cwæð seo nædre eft to ðam wife: Ne beo ge nateshwondeade, ðeah ðe ge of ðam treowe eton.
Ac God wat soðlice ðæt eowre eagan beoð geopenode on swahwylcum dæge swa ge etað of ðam treowe,& ge beoð ðonne englum gelice, witende ægðer ge god geyfel.
ða geseah ðæt wif ðæt ðæt treow wæs god to etenne, beðam ðe hyre ðuhte, & wlitig on eagum &lustbære on gesyhðe, & genam ða of ðæs treowes wæstme &geæt & sealde hyre were: he æt ða.
& heora begra eagan wurdon geopenode; hi oncneowon ða ðæthi nacode wæron, & sywodon him ficleaf,& worhton him wædbrec.
Eft ða ða God com, & hi gehyrdon his stemne ðær he eodeon neorxnawange ofer midne dæg, ðabehydde Adam hine, & his wif eac swa dyde, fram Godesgesihðe on middan ðam treowe neorxnanwonges.
God clypode ða Adam, & cwæð: Adam, hwær eart ðu.
He cwæð: ðine stemne ic gehire, leof, on neorxnawange, &ic ondræde me, for ðam ðe ic eom nacod,& ic behyde me.
God cwæð: Hwa sæde ðe ðæt ðu nacod wære, gyf ðu neæte of ðam treowe ðe ic ðe bebead ðæt ðu neæte.
Adam cwæð: ðæt wif ðe ðu me forgeafe to geferan, sealdeme of ðam treowe, & ic ætt.
God cwæð to ðam wife: Hwi dydestu ðæt; heo cwæð: Seonædre bepæhte me & ic ætt.
God cwæð to ðære næddran: For ðan ðe ðu ðis dydest,ðu bist awyrged betweox eallum nytenum &wildeorum: ðu gæst on ðinum breoste & etst ða eorðaneallum dagum ðines lifes.
Ic sette feondrædene betwux ðe & ðam wife & ðinumofspringe & hire ofspringe; heo tobrytt ðinheafod & ðu syrwst ongean hire ho.
To ðam wife cwæð God eac swylce: Ic gemænifylde ðineyrmða & ðine geeacnunga; on sarnysse ðuacenst cild, & ðu bist under weres anwealde & he gewylt ðe.

To Adame he cwæð: For ðan ðe ðu gehyrdes ðines wifesstemne, & ðu æte of ðam treowe ðe ic ðebebead ðæt ðu ne æte, is seo eorðe awyrged on ðinumweorce: on geswyncum ðu etst of ðære eorðaneallum dagum ðines lifes.
ðornas & bremelas heo aspryt ðe, & ðu ytst ðære eorðanwyrta.
On swate ðines andwlitan ðu brycst ðines hlafes, oð ðætðu gewende to eorðan of ðære ðe ðugenumen wære, for ðan ðe ðu eart dust & to duste gewyrst.
ða gesceop Adam naman his wife, Eua, ðæt is lif, for ðanðe heo is ealra libbendra modor.
God worhte eac Adame & his wife fellene reaf & gescrydde hi.
& cwæð: Nu Adam can yfel & god, swa swa ure sum, ðe læshe astrecce his hand & nime eac swylce oflifes treowe & ete & libbe on ecnysse.
Adræfde hine ða of neorxnawange, ðæt he ða eorðanworhte & him ðæron tilode, of ðære ðe hegenumen wæs.
MEN wurdon ða gemenigfylde ofer eorðan & dohtra gestryndon.
ða gesawon Godes bearn, ðæt wæron gode men, manna dohtraðæt hi wæron wlitige, & namon him wif ofeallum ðam ðe hi gecuron.
& God cwæð ða: Ne ðurhwunað na min gast on men onecnysse, for ðan ðe he is flæsc.
Entas wæron eac swylce ofer eorðan on ðam dagum, æfterðan ðe Godes bearn tymdon wið manna dohtra& hi cendon: ða synd mihtige fram worulde & hlisfulleweras.
ða geseah God ðæt micel yfelnys manna wæs ofer eorðan, &eal geðanc manna heortena wæs awend onyfel on eallum timan.
Gode ofðuhte ða ðæt he mann geworhte ofer eorðan: hewolde ða warnian on ær & wæs gehrepod midheortan sarnysse wiðinnan.
& cwæð: Ic adylgie ðone man, ðe ic gesceop, fram ðæreeorðan ansyne, fram ðam men oð ða nytenu,fram ðam slincendum oð ða fugelas: me ofðingð soðliceðæt ic hi worhte.
Noe soðlice wæs Gode gecweme, & gyfe ætforan him gemette.
ðas synd Noes cneornyssa: Noe wæs rihtwis wer & fulfremedon his mægðum; mid Gode he ferde.
& gestrynde ðry suna Sem & Cham & Iaphet.
ða wæs eall seo eorðe gewemmed ætforan Gode & afylledmid unrihtwisnysse.
ða geseah God ðæt seo eorðe wæs gewemmed, for ðan ðeælc flæsc gewemde his weg ofer eorðan.
& God cwæð ða to Noe: Geendung ealles flæsces comætforan me; seo eorðe is afylled midunrihtwisnysse fram heora ansyne, & ic fordo hi mid ðæreeorðan samod.
Wyrc ðe nu ane arc of aheawenum bordum & ðu wyrcst wunungabinnan ðam arce & clæmst wiðinnan &wiðutan mid tyrwan.
& ðu wyrcst hine ðus: ðreohund fæðma bið se arc onlenge, & fiftig fæðma on bræde, & ðritig onheahnysse.
ðu wyrcst ðæron egðyrl & ðu tihst his heahnyssetogædere on ufeweardum to anre fæðme; duru ðusetst be ðære sidan wiðneoðan, & ðu macast ðreo fleringabinnan ðam arce.
Efne ic gebringe flodes wæteru ofer eorðan, ðæt ic ofsleaeall flæsc on ðam ðe is lifes gast underheofonum: ealle ða ðing ðe on eorðan synd beoðfornumene.
Ic sette min wedd to ðe, & ðu gæst in to ðam arce, &ðine suna, & ðin wif & ðinra suna wif midðe.
& of eallum nytenum ealles flæsces twegen gemacan ðu lætstin to ðam arce mid ðe, ðæt hi libbanmagon.
Eac of fugelum be heora cynne, & of eallum orfcynne, & ofeallum creopendum cynne twam & twamfaran in mid ðe, ðæt hi magon libban.
ðu nimst witodlice of eallum mettum, ðe to mete magon, into ðe, ðæt hi beon ægðer ge ðe ge himto bigleofan.
Noe soðlice dyde ealle ða ðing, ðe him God bebead.
AND God cwæð to him: Gang in to ðam arce & eal ðinhiwræden, ðe ic geseah soðlice rihtwisneætforan me on þisre mægðe.
Nim in to ðe of eallum clænum nytenum seofan & seofanægðres gecyndes & of unclænum twam & twam.
& of fugelcynne seofan & seofan ægðres gecyndes, & sæd sigehealden ofer ealre eorðan bradnysse.
Ic soðlice sende ren nu embe seofan niht ofer eorðanfeowertig daga & feowertig nihta togædere &ic adylegie ealle ða edwiste, ðe ic worhte ofer eorðanbradnysse.
Noe ða dyde ealle ða ðingc ðe him God bebead.
& he wæs ða sixhund geara on ylde, ða ða ðæs flodeswæteru yðedon ofer eorðan.
Hwæt ða Noe eode in to ðam arce, & his ðry suna & hiswif & histo dældontodældonwif, for ðæs flodeswæterum.
Eac swylce ða nytenu of eallum cynne & eallum fugolcynne.
comon to Noe in to ðam arce, swa swa God bebead.
þa on ðam eahtoðan dæge, ða ða hi inne wæron & God hibelocen hæfde wiðutan, ða yðode ðæt flodofer eorðan.
On ðam oðrum monðe, on ðone seofonteoðan dæg ðæsmonðes, ða asprungon ealle wyllspringas ðæremiclan nywelnysse & þære heofenan wæterðeotan wærongeopenode.
& hit rinde ða ofer eorðan feowertig daga & feowertig nihtaon an.
Wæs ða geworden micel flod & ða wæteru wæron gemenifylde&to dældontodældonup ðone arc.
& yðodon swyðe & gefyldon ðære eorðan bradnysse:witodlice se arc wæs geferod ofer ða wæteru.
& ðæt wæter swyðrode swylce ofer eorðan; wurdon ðabehelede ealle ða heahstan duna under ealreheofenan.
& ðæt wæter wæs fyftyne fæðma deop ofer ða heahstanduna.
Wearð ða fornumen eal flæsc ðe ofer eorðan styrode,manna & fugela, nytena & creopendra.
& ælc ðingc ðe lif hæfde wearð adyd on ðam deopanflode.
Buton ðam anum ðe binnan ðam arce wæron.
ðæt flodto dældontodældonða swa anhund daga & fiftig daga.
& GOD ða gemunde Noes fare & ðæra nytena ðe him midwæron, & asende wind ofer eorðan, & ða wæteruwurdon gewanode.
& ðato dældontodældonðære miclan nywelnysse wurdonfordytte & ðære heofonan wæterðeotan, & se renwearð forboden.
ða wæteru ða gecyrdon of ðære eorðan ongean farende &begunnon to wanigenne æfter oðer healfhunddaga.
ða ætstod se arc on ðam seofoðan monðe ofer ða muntasArmenisces landes.
& ða wæteru toeodan & wanodon of ðone teoðan monð, & onðam teoðan monðe æteowedon ðæra muntacnollas.
ða æfter feowertigum dagum undyde Noe his eahðyrl, ðe heon ðam arce gemacode.
& asende ut ænne hremn: se hrem fleah ða ut & nolde eftongean cyrran, ær ðan ðe ða wæteruadruwodon ofer eorðan.
He asende ða eft ut ane culfran, ðæt heo sceawode gyf ðawætera ðagyt geswicon ofer ðære eorðanbradnysse.
Heo ða fleah ut & ne mihte findan hwær heo hire fot asette,for ðan ðe ða wætera wæron ofer ealleeorðan; & heo gecyrde ongean to Noe, & he genam hi in toðam arce.
He abad ða gyt oðre seofan dagas & asende ut eft culfran.
Heo com ða on æfnunge eft to Noe, & brohte an twig of anumelebeame mid grenum leafum on hyremuðe.ða undergeat Noe ðæt ða wætera wæron adruwode ofereorðan.
& abad swa ðeah seofan dagas & asende ut culfran; swa heo negecyrde ongean to him.
ða geopenode Noe ðæs arces hrof, & beheold ut & geseahðætto dældontodældoneorðan bradnis wæs adruwod.
God ða spræc to Noe, ðus cweðende.
Gang ut of ðam arce, ðu & þin wif & ðine suna & heorawif.
& eal ðæt ðær inne is mid ðe, læd ut mid ðe ofereorðan, & weaxe ge & beoð gemænifylde ofereorðan.
Noe ða ut eode of ðam arce, & hi ealle ofer eorðan.
& he arærde an weofod Gode, & genam of eallum ðam clænumnytenum & clænum fugelum, & geoffrodeGode lac on ðam weofode.

God ða underfeng his lac & ðære winsumnysse bræð, &cwæð him to: Nelle ic nateshwon awyrgean ðaeorðan heononforð for mannum; andgyt & geþoht menniscreheortan syndon forðhealde to yfele framiugoðe; Eornostlice ne ofslea ic heononforð mid wætere ælcðingc cuces, swa swa ic dyde.
Eallum dagum ðære eorðan, sæd & gerip, cyle & hæte,sumor & winter, dæg & niht ne geswicað.
GOD bletsode ða Noe & his suna, & cwæð him to: Weaxað &beoð gemenifylde & afyllað ða eorðan.
& beo eower ege & oga ofer ealle nytenu & fugelas & oferealle ða ðingc ðe on eorðan styriað;Ealle sæfixas syndon eowrum handum betæhte.
& eal ðæt ðe styrað & leofað beo eow to mete, swa swagrowende wyrta ic hi betæce ealle eow.
Butan ðam anum ðæt ge flæsc mid blode ne eton.
Eower blod ic ofgange æt eallum wildeorum & eac æt ðammen; of ðæs weres handa & his broðor handaic ofgange ðæs mannes lif.
Swa hwa swa agyt ðæs mannes blod, his blod byð agoten;witodlice to Godes anlicnysse is se mangeworht.
Weaxe ge nu & beoð gemænifylde & gað ofer eorðan &gefyllað hi.
God cwæð eft to Noe & to his sunum.
Efne nu ic sette min wed to eow & to eowrum ofspringe.
& to eallum libbendum nytenum ðe of ðam arce eodon.
ðæt ic nateshwon nelle heononforð eal flæsc adydon midflodes wæterum; ne heononforð ne bið flodtosencende ða eorðan.
ðis bið ðæt tacn mines weddes ðæt ic do betwux me & eow& eallum libbendum nytenum on ecummægðum.
ðæt is, ðæt ic sette minne renbogan on wolcnum, & he byðtacn mines weddes betwux me & ðæreeorðan.
þonne ic oferteo heofonan mid wolcnum, ðonne æteowað minboga on ðam wolcnum.
& ic beo gemyndig mines weddes wið eow, ðæt heononforðne byð flod to adylgienne eall flæsc.
Bið ðonne se min renboga on ðam wolcnum & ic hine geseo &beo gemyndig ðæs ecean weddes, ðe gesetis betwux Gode & eallum libbendum flæsce, ðe ofer eorðanis.
ðis byð ðæt tacn mines weddes ðæt ic gesette betwux me& eallum flæsce ofer eorðan.
Wæron ða Noes suna ðe of ðam arce eodan: Sem & Cham &Iaphet; & Cham witodlice is fæder ðæreChananeiscre ðeode.
& of ðisum ðrym Noes sunum is tosawen eall mancyn ofereorðan.
Noe ðato dældontodældonbegan to wyrcenne ðæt land & gesettehim wingeard.
& ða ða he dranc of ðam wine, ða wearð he druncen & lægon his getelde unbehelod.
His sunu ða, Cham, geseah his gesceapu unbeheled, & cyddehit his twam gebroðrum ut on felda.
Hwæt, ða Sem & Iapheth dydon anne hwitel on heorasculdrum, & eodon underbæc & beheledon heorafæderes gecynd, swa ðæt hi ne gesawon his næcednysse.
Noe soðlice ða ða he awoc of ðam slæpe, & he ofaxodehwæt his suna him dydon.
ða cwæð he: Awyrged is Chanaan, & he byð ðeowena ðeowahis gebroðrum.
& he cwæð: Gebletsod is Drihten, Semes God; beo Chanaanhis ðeowa.
Gemænifylde God Iapheð, & he wunie on Semes geteldum, &beo Chanaan his ðeowa.
Noe ða leofode ðreohund geara & fiftig geara æfter ðamflode.
HER swutelað þæs ælmihtigan Godes mildheortnyss & hyswundra, hu he Abraham geceas & hysbletsunga him sealde & hys ofspringe.
God cwæð þa to Abrame: Far of þinum lande & of ðinremægðe & of ðines fæder huse, & cum to þamlande þe ic ðe geswutelige.
& ic macige ðe mycelre mægðe & þe gebletsige & ðinnenaman ic gemærsige, & ðu byst gebletsod.
Ic gebletsige ða þe ðe bletsiað, & ic awyrige ða þeðe wyriað, & on þe beoð gebletsode ealreeorðan mægða.
Abram ða ferde of Aran, swa swa God him bead, & Loth ferdemid him.
Mid ealre fare & mid eallum æhtum, oð þæt hi comon toþam lande Chanaan.
& Abram sceawode ðæt land, & ða gemæru: Chananeus wæsþa on lande.
God þa geswutelode hyne sylfne Abrame, & cwæð him to:þinum ofspringe ic forgyfe ðis land; Hwæt,þa Abram arærde ðær an weofod Gode, þe him æteowde.
& ferde syððan to þam munte be eastan Bethel, be westanHai, & þær gesloh hys geteld & arærde þæran weofod Gode, & hys naman ðær clypode.
þanon he ferde eft to ðam suðdæle þæs landes.
& hyt wearð þa mycel hungorgear on þam lande; Abram ðaferde to Egypta lande, wolde þær onælþeodinysse anbidian, for ðan ðe se hunger ðearleswyðrode.
Mid ðam ðe hi wæron gehende Egypta lande, þa cwæðAbram to hys wife: Ic wat ðæt þu eart wlitig onhiwe.
& þonne ða Egyptiscean ðe geseoð, þonne cweðaþ hiðæt þu min wif sy, & hi ofsleað me & ðehealdað.
Sege nu, ic ðe bidde, þæt ðu min swuster sy, þæt me welsy for ðe, & min sawel lybbe for þinumintingan.
Hi comon ða to Egypta lande, & ða Egyptiscean gesawon ðætþæt wif wæs swyðe wlitig.
& ðæs cyninges ealdormen spæcon be hyre wlite to þamcyninge Farao, & heredon hi beforan him; þætwif wearð þa gelæht & gelædd to þam cyninge.
& Abram underfeng fela sceatta for hyre: he hæfde ða onorfe & on ðeowum, on oluendum & on assummycele æhta.
God soðlice beswang Farao þone cyning mid þam mæstumwitum & ealne hys hired for Sarai, Abrameswife.
Farao ða het clypian Abram, & cwæð him to: Hwæt la, hwidydest ðu swa wið me; hwi noldest ðusecgan þæt heo þin wif ys.
For hwylcon intingan sædest ðu þæt heo ðin swustorwære; efne nu her ys ðin wif: nim hig and farðe aweg.
Abram þa ferde of Egypta lande mid ealre hys fare, & Faraose cyning him funde ladmen.
& LOTH ferde forð mid him, oð ðæt hi comon to suðdæle
betwux Bethel & Hai.
To ðære stowe þe he ðæt weofod ær arærde, & gebædhyne ðær to Gode.
& Loth samod mid him.Abram soðlice wæs swyðe welig on golde & on seolfre & onorfe & on geteldum.
Swa þæt þæt land ne mihte aberan þæt hi begen, he &Loth, ætgædere wunedon: heora æhta wæronmenigfealde & ne mihton wunian ætgædere.
Wearð eac ðurh þone intingan sacu betwux Abrameshyrdemannum & Lothes; On ðære tide wunedonChananeus & Ferezeus on ðam lande.
Abram þa cwæð to Lothe: Ic bidde þæt nan sacu ne sybetwux me & ðe, ne betwux minum hyrdum &ðinum hyrdum; wyt synd gebroðru.
Efne nu eall seo eorðe lið ætforan ðe: ic bidde, far framme: gyf ðu færst to þære wynstranhealfe, ic healde þa swyðran healfe;gyf þu ðonne þa swyðran healfe gecyst,ic fare to þære wynstran healfe.

Loth ða beheold geond eall, & geseah þæt eall se eard wiðða ea Iordanen wæs myrge mid wæteregemenged, swa swa Godes neorxnawang, & swa swa Egypta landbecumendum to Segor, ær þan þe Godtowende ða burga Sodomam & Gomorran.
Loth ða geceas him þone eard wið Iordanen & ferde frameastdæle, & hi wurdon totwæmede heoraægðer fram hys breðer.
Abram eardode ða on þam lande Chanaan: Loth soðlicewunode on þam fæstenum ðe wæron embeIordanen, & he eardode on þære byrig Sodoma.
þa Sodomitiscan men wæron forcuðostan & swyðe synfulleætforan Gode.
God cwæð ða to Abrame, æfter ðan þe Loth wæs totwæmedhim fram: Ahefe upp þine eagan & behealdfram ðære stowe þe ðu on stenst to norðdæle & tosuðdæle & to eastdæle & to westdæle.
Eal ðis land þe ðu gesyxt, ic forgyfe ðe & þinumofsprincge on ecnysse.
& ic do þinne ofsprincg swa menigfealdne swa swa ðæreeorðan dust: gyf ænig man mæg geriman ðæreeorðan dust, þonne mæg he eac swylce geriman þinneofspring.
Aris nu & far geond þis land on lencge & bræde, for ðanðe ic hyt þe forgyfe.
Abram þa eornostlice astyrode hys geteld, & com & eardodewið þone dene Mambre, þæt ðe ys onEbron, & þær arærde weofod Gode.
HYT gelamp ða on þære tide þæt ða cyningas wunnon himbetwynan.
iiii ciningas wið v cyningas, oð ðæt hi comon togefeohte.
þa feollon ða cyningas on ðam gefeohte ofslagene, ofSodomam & Gomorran, þæra manfulra ðeoda, &heora geferan flugon afyrhte to muntum.
þa namon þa sigefæstan cyningas sona on þam burgumSodoma & Gomorra ða god þe hi ðær fundon.
& eac læddon aweg Loth mid hys æhtum, Abrames broðorsunu, ðe on þam burgum eardode.
ða ætbærst him sum man, & se hyt sæde Abrame, hu man hysbroðor sunu on bendum aweg lædde.
Abram ða genam ardlice ðreohund manna & eahtatyne men ofhys inbyrdlingum, & efste wið ðæs heres,oð ðæt he hi ofrad.
Todælde ða hys geferan færlice on þære nihte, & him onberæsde & on eornost hi sloh & afligde ðalafe, oð ðæt hi comon to Fenicen.
He lædde þa ongean Loth, hys broðor sunu, mid eallum hysæhtum, & ðæt oðer folc samod, mid wifum& æhtum, gewunnenum sige.
þa eode Sodomitiscra cyning sona him togeanes.
& bæd þæt he hæfde eall þæt he of ðam here genam,buton þam mannum anum.
& Abram him cwæð to: Ic ahebbe mine hand to ðam healicanGode. se ðe ys agnigend eorðan & heofonan,
þæt ic ne underfo furðon ænne ðwang of eallum þisumðingum ðe þine ær wæron, ðæt þu ne secge eft: Icgewelgode Abram.
Buton ðam anum ðingon, ðe mine geferan æton, & þæramanna dæl þe me mid comon, Anær, & Escol, &Mambre; nymon þas heora dæl.
þær com eac Melchisedech, se mæra Godes man, se wæscyning & Godes sacerd; & he brohte hlaf &win.
& bletsode Abram, & cwæð: Gebletsod ys Abram ðam healicanGode, se ðe gesceop heofenan & eorðan.
GOD wolde þa fandian Abrahames gehyrsumnysse, & clypode hysnaman.
& cwæð him ðus to: Nym ðinne ancennedan sunu Isaac, þeðu lufast, & far to þam lande Visionishraðe, & geofra hyne þær uppan anre dune.
Abraham ða aras on þære ylcan nihte & ferde mid twamcnapum to þam fyrlenum lande, & Isaac samod,on assum ridende.
þa on ðone ðriddan dæg, þa hi ða dune gesawon, ðærðær hi to sceoldon to ofsleane Isaac.
ða cwæð Abraham to þam cnapum ðus: Anbidiað eow hermid þam assum sume hwile: ic & þæt cild gaðunc to gebiddenne, & we syððan cumað sona eft to eow.
Abraham þa het Isaac beran þone wudu to þære stowe, & hesylf bær hys swurd & fyr.
Isaac ða axode Abraham hys fæder: Fæder min, ic axigehwær seo offrung sy; her ys wuda & fyr.
Him andwyrde se fæder: God foresceawað, min sunu, him sylfða offrunge.

Hi comon þa to ðære stowe þe him geswutelode God, & heðær weofod arærde on ða ealdan wisan, &þone wudu gelogode, swa swa he hyt wolde habban to hys sunabærnette syððan he ofslagen wurde; Hegeband þa hys sunu.
& hys swurd ateah þæt he hyne geoffrode on þa ealdanwisan.
Mid ðam ðe he wolde þæt weorc begynnan, ða clypode Godesengel ardlice of heofonum, Abraham; Heandwyrde sona.
Se engel him cwæð to: Ne acwel ðu þæt cild, ne þinehand ne astrece ofer hys swuran: nu iconcneow soðlice, þæt ðu swyðe ondrætst God, nu þu þinneancennedan sunu ofslean woldest for him.
ða beseah Abraham sona underbæc, & geseah ðær ænne rambetwux þam bremelum be ðam hornum gehæft,& he ahefde ðone ram to ðære offrunge & hyne þær ofsnaðGode to lace for hys sunu Isaac.
He het þa þa stoweto dældontodældon, þæt ys God gesyhð,& gyt ys gesæd swa:to dældontodældon, þæt ys God gesyhð on dune.
Eft clypode se engel Abraham, & cwæð.
Ic swerige ðurh me sylfne, sæde se ælmihtiga, nu ðunoldest arian þinum ancennedan suna, ac ðewæs min ege mare þonne hys lif.
Ic ðe nu bletsige & ðinne ofspringe gemenigfylde swa swasteorran on heofonum & swa swasandceosel on sæ; þin ofsprincg sceal agan heora feonda gatu.
& on þinum sæde beoð ealle ðeoda gebletsode, for þan ðeþu gehyrsumodest minre hæse ðus.

æFTER ðam ðe Moyses, se mæra heretoga, mid Israhelafolce, swa swa him God bebead, ofer ða ReadanSæ ferde, & Farao adrenced wæs, & syððan se ælmihtigaGod him æ geset hæfde, ða ða seo fyrd comto Pharan ðam westene, ða cwæð se heofonlica God to ðamhalgan Moyse:
Ceos ðe nu men þæt magon sceawian ðone eard Chanaan landes,ðe ic Israhela folce forgyfan wille to heora gewealde, & asendtwelf heafodmen of ðam twelf mægðum.
ða dyde Moyses swa God him bebead, & sende of ðam westene,ðe is genemned Pharan, twelfsceaweras,

þe heora naman her synd awritene: Of Ruben, SemmuaSechores sunu; of Simeon, Saphath Vriessunu; of Iudas, Chaleb Ieppones sunu; of Efraim, Osee Nunessunu; of Isachar, Igal Iosepessunu; of Beniamin, Psalthi Raphues sunu; of Zabulon, IedidelSodiys sunu; of Ioseph, GaddiSusius sunu; of Dan, Amihel Iemallies sunu; of Aser, SturMichaheles sunu; of Neptalim, NaabdiVaphsies sunu; of Gad, Guel Mathies sunu.
ðis synd ðara manna naman, ðe Moyses sende to sceawigenneChanaan land.
& ðus cwæð: Farað geond ðone suðdæl,
& sceawiað ðæt land, hwæðer hit wæstmbære sy &mid wudum gemencged,& ða burga gebette oððe butan weallum, &hwæðer ðæt landfolc sy to gefeohte stranglicoððe untrumlic, feawa on getele hwæðer ðe fela.
& feriað mid eow of ðære eorðan wæstmum, ðonne ge eftcumað; Hit wæs ða se tima ðe winberianripodon.
& hi ferdon ða sona & sceawodon þone eard,
& geond feowertig daga embferdon ðone eard.
& of ðam winbogum mid berium mid ealle & æpplum & ofætumeft mid him brohton.
& comon to Moyse, þær he mid ðære fyrde wæs, on Pharanðam westene.
& ðas word him to cwædon: We comon to ðam earde þe ge usheton faran, þe flewð witodlice meolce &hunie, swa swa ge of ðisum wæstmum wel oncnawon magon.
Ac þa strengstan weras wuniað on ðam lande & micele burgaðær synd & mærlice geweallode: ðær wegesawon Enachus cynryn.
Amalech eac swylce eardað on ðam suðdæle, Etheus on ðammuntlandum, & Iebuseus & Amorreus,Chananeus wið ða sæ & ymb ða ea Iordan.

Hwæt ða Israhela bearn endemes hrymdon ongean Moysenmiclum ceorodon; ac Caleph hi gestilde, &cwæð mid gebylde: Vton faran to þam earde, & geagnian usðæt land, for ðan ðe we magon mid mihtehit begytan.
ða oðre soðlice cwædon, þe mid him asende wæron: Nemage we faran nateshwon to ðam folce þus, forðan þe hi synd strengran þonne we.
& we ðær gesawon of ðam entcynne Enachys bearna micelrawæstma, ðam we ne synd ðe gelicran ðelytle gærstapan.
& hi tældon ðæt land mid heora teonwordum.
HWæT ða, eal seo mæniu endemes weop sona, & miclumceorodon ongean Moysen, & cwædon:

We wisceað ðæt we on Egypta lande wæron ær deade& na on ðisum westene, & we wisceað swyðor þæt weforwurðon her & us Drihten ne læde in to ðam lande,þæt we ðær licgon ofslagene & ure wif & cyld wurðongehergode; Nis us, la, betere þæt we bugon ongean to Egyptalande?
& ælc cwæð to oðrum: Vton us gesettan efne nu heretogan &uton gecyrran to Egypta lande.
Moyses ða & Aaron miclum wurdon astyrode & feollon astrehteætforan ðære mæniu.
Caleph ða & Iosue cwædon to ðam folce:
þæt land ðe we sceawodon is swyðe ðearle god.
Gyf Drihten us arfæst bið, he us in gelæt to ðam, & sylðus ða moldan þe meolce & hunie flewð.
Ne beo ge wiðerræde wið eowerne Drihten, ne ge neondrædon eow; Drihten is mid us.
ða hrymde eal seo mæniu & mid stanum woldon hi oftorfian;ac Godes wuldor wearð sona wundorliceæteowod ofer ðæt Godes scrin, þær hi on locodon.
& God cwæð to Moyse: Hu lange tælð þis folc me, & hulange ne gelyfað hi me on eallum ðam tacnumþe ic ætforan him dyde?
Ic ofslea hi mid cwylde & hi fordo mid cwealme, & ic ðegesette syððan to heretogan ofer miceleðeode strengran þonne ðeos.

Moyses ða clypode, & ðus cwæð to Drihtne: Gyf ðaEgyptiscean gehyrað, & ða ðe her eardiaðabutan, þæt ðu þas mæniu ofslihst swa swa anne mannan,þonne secgað hi sona þæt ðu ofsloge hi for ði,þæt ðu ne mihtæst hi gelædan to ðam lande ðe ðu himbehete.
Ac sy þin strengð gemærsod, swa swa ðu swore.
Drihten, ic ðe bidde ðæt ðu forgyfe þises folces synnaæfter micelnisse þinre mildheortnysse.
Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Ic hit forgyfe æfter ðinum worde.

Swa ðeah soðlice ealle þa ðe gesawon mine mægnðrymnysse& ða miclan tacna, ðe ic worhte on Egyptalande & on þisum westene, & costnodon me nu tyn siðon &mine stemne ne gehyrsumodon, ne geseoðhi ðæt land, þe ic foreswor heora fæderum, ne nan þæraðe me tælde ne gesihð ðæt land.
Caleph & Iosue cumað to þam lande.
Eowre bearn ic læde to þam lande soðlice.
& eowre lic sceolan licgan on þisum westene.
Eowre bearn beoð worigende on þisum westene feowertigwintra & eower forligr berað, oð ðæt heorafædera hreaw beon fornumene.
æfter ðæra feowertigra daga getæle, þe ge ðæt landbesceawodon, ger bið for dæge geteald, & onfeowertigum gearum ge underfoð eowre unrihtwisnyssa, þæt gewiton mine wrace.
ða wurdon sona ofslagene on Godes gesihðe ða tynsceaweras, þe sceawodon ðæt land, & deade nyðerfeollon, for ðan ðe hi þæt folc mistihton & þæt landtæl.
& ða twegen leofodan, Iosue & Caleph, & hi comon to þamlande.
ða weop þæt folc sare,& sona on ærne merien astigongewæpnode up to ðære dune, & cwædon: Wesynd gearwe nu to gewinnenne þæt land be ðam ðe Drihtenspræc, for ðan þe we syngodon.
ða cwæð Moyses to andsware: Hwi ofergæge ge Godes word;Hit ne becymð eow na to nanre spede.
Ne fare ge, ic bidde, for ðan þe God nis mid eow, þæt gene feallon ætforan eowrum feondum.
Hi swa ðeah ablende beotlice astygon to ðæs muntescnæppe.
& æFTER ðam færlice arison feower weras, Chore & Hon,Dathan & Abiron, ongean Moysen miclumastyrode, & ðridde healf hund manna of ðam yldstum mannum;
& cwædon to Moyse & to Aarone þam sacerde: Eall ðeosmæniu soðlice syndon haligra bearn & God wunað on him:Hwi synd ge ahafene ofer Drihtnes folc?
& Moyses feoll astreht sona to eorðan.
& to ðam folce cwæð: To mergen geswutelað God hwilce hegecyst to him.
Nime eower ælc his storcyllan & stere ætforan Gode; &þone þe he gecyst, beo se halig.
Hi dydon swa on mergen mid miclum gedwylde & brohton heorastorcyllan, standende æt ðam getelde.
Ac Dathan & Abiron stodon on heora geteldum.
& cwædon to Moyse mid miclum graman:
Is ðe, la, lytel geðuht þæt ðu alæddest us of ðamlande þe weol meolce & hunige, þæt ðu us ofsloge onþisum westene, butan þu eac ure gewealde?
Witodlice þu gelæddest us in to ðam lande þe eall flewðon riðum meolce &to dældontodældon& sealdest usland & æhta & wingeardas ðær; oððe wilt ðu, la, utapytan ure eagan?
ða æteowde Godes wuldor.
& God cwæð to Moyse:
Asyndriað eow fram ðisre scyldigan gegaderunge, þæt ic hifærlice fordon mæge.
Hwæt ða færlice geopenode seo eorðe hi sylfe & forswealhða weras mid wifum & cildum, Dathan &Abiron, mid heora geteldum & eallum æhtum,
þæt hi in to helle cuce siðodon mid sande ofhrorene.
& þæt folc fleah afyrht for heora hreame.
Eac swylce færlice fyr com fram Gode & ofsloh ða oþre þeoffrodon ðone stor, ðridde healf hundmanna, þær hi heoldon þa recelsfata.
Eft on ðam oðrum dæge eall seo mæniu ceorode ongeanMoysen & Aaron, cweðende: Ge ofslogon Godesfolc.
& seo sacu ða aras.
& Moyses & Aaron efston mid fleame to Godes getelde, & þaða hi in agan wæron, ða ætywde Godeswuldor.
& God cwæð to Moyse:
Gewitað aweg fram ðisre mæniu; nu ic hi adylgie.
& Moyses cwæð to Aarone: Nim ðin recelsfæt & efst to ðamfolce & for hi gebide, for ðan ðe Godesyrre is ofer hi & his wite reðegað.
Aaron ða ardlice arn to ðam folce & sterde mid thimiamastandende betwynan ðam cucuan & ðamdeadum, & bæd for ðæt folc; ðæt wite ða geswac.
& þær wæron ofslagene feowertyne ðusenda of ðæs folcesmæniu & seofonhund mannato dældontodældonðam ðe ðærofslagene wæron on Choresto dældontodældon.
Aaron eode ða eft to Moyse to Drihtnes getelde.
& Drihten cwæð to Moyse:
Nim nu twelf gyrda æt ðam twelf mægðum fram þæremægða ealdrum, & heora ælces naman awrit on his gyrde& Aarones nama beo on Leuies mægðe, & lege ða gyrda onðam getelde þær ic ðe to sprece.
& þone þe ic geceose, þonne sprytt his gyrd, & ic gestillefram me Ysrahela ceorunge.
Moyses ða dyde swa swa Drihten him bebead.
& eode on ærne merien in to ðam getelde, & efne ða wæsgrowende Aarones gyrd on blostmum & onleafum on hnutbeames wisan.
He bær ða ða gyrda to Ysrahela bearnum, & hi gesawon hwætþær geswutelod wæs; ælc nam þa hisgyrde.
& God cwæð eft to Moyse: Ber Aarones gyrde in to ðamgetelde, ðæt heo sy gehealden Israhele totacne & heora ceorung geswice, þæt hi ne swelton.
GOD geceas Aaron him to sacerde & of his ofsprincge to hisoffrunge symle & of Leuies mægðemanega to Leuita Aarone to fylste to ðam ælicumonsægednyssum, & God sylf him sealde ða gesetnyssa.
æFTER þisum comon Israhela bearn to ðam westene Sin, &ðær sweolt Maria, Aarones swustor, & isðær bebyrged.
ða næs ðær nan wæter on þam westene þam folce.
& hi ða ciddon swiðe wið Moysen.
He clypode ða to Gode.
& God cwæð to him:
Gang ðu & Aaron & gegaderiað þis folc geond to ðam stane;& se stan eow sylþ wæter.
Hi comon ða to ðam flinte.
& he ætforan him eallon sloh mid ðære gyrde tua þoneflint, & þær fleow sona of ðam flinte wæterswa genihtsumlice, þæt heora nytena druncon & eall Israhelafolc of ðære anre riðe.
ða sende Moyses ærendracan to Edom þam cynincge;
Bæd þæt he moste faran forð ofer his land berihtum wege & ne reppan his nan þingc.
Edom ða andwyrde þam ærendracum, & cwæð: Ne fare geðurh me.
& he ferde ða sona mid eallon his folce to gefeohte gearu:& forwyrnde Israhele þæt oferfæreldþurh his land; Hi gewendon þa aweg, & gewicodon wið ðonemunt, þe is Or gehaten.
þær Aaron forðferde & Eleazarus, his sunu, wæs sacerd forhine.
& hi ealle beweopon Aarones forðsið geond xxx dagageomriende swyðe.
CHANANEUS þa wann wið Israhela bearn, & sige on himgewann.
Ac hi wendon to Gode mid ealre heortan.
& hi gehyrde God, & him sige forgeaf, þæt hi ofslogon þonecyningc & his folc samod mid swurdesecge & heora burga towendon.
& gewendon him ham ðanon ofer langne weg, þæt hi þætland embferdon; þæt folc wearð ða aðryt &ðearle geswenct mid ðam siðfæte.

& ceorodon ongean Godd & ongean Moysen miclum, & cwædon:Hwi læddest ðu, la, us of Egypta lande,þæt we swulton on þisum westene; We nabbað naðor ne hlafne wæter, & us wlataþ nu for ðisumleohtostan mete.
For ðam ðingon þa sona sende God him to fyrene næddran, &hi ðæt folc totæron & manega adyddon.
& hi to Moyse cwædon: We syngodon swyðe, for ðan ðe weswa spæcon ongean God & ðe; ac gebide forus, þæt he afyrsige fram us ða fyrene næddran; Moyses ðagebæd for ðæt folc.
& God cwæð to him: Wyrc ane ærene næddran & sete upp totacne, & se ðe tosliten beo, beseo upp toðære næddran, & he leofoð sona swa he besyhð on hi.
Moyses ða worhte ða ærenan næddran, & sette to tacne; &þa ðe toslitene wæron beheoldon to ðærenæddran & wurdon gehælede.
Hi ferdon ða ðanon mid heora fyrdwicum.
& Moyses sende ða to Seon, ðam cyninge Amoreiscre ðeode,ðisum wordum, & cwæð:
Ic bidde ðæt ðu me lyfe ofer ðin land to farene; Nereppe we ðine æceras oððe wineardas, eowwer wæterpyttas;ac swa swa se weg lið we farað, gyf we moton, forð oferðin land.

ða nolde Seon, se cyningc, nateshwon him tiðian þætIsrahel ferde forð ofer his gemæru, acgegaderode his folc & ferde him togenes & feaht swyðe ongean,oð ðæt he feol ofslagen, & his folcsamod, mid swurdes ecge.
Hi geeodon ða his land & ealle his burga, & Israhel wunodeþa on þam widgillan lande.
Moyses ða sende & het sceawian Azer; þære wic hi geeodon& ahton þone eard.
Hi gewendon ða ðanon & woldon to Basan, ac Og, se cyning,com him togeanes mid eallum his folceto gefeohte gearu.
Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Ne ondræd ðu hine; ic hine sealdeto þinum gewealde & eall his folc &land.
& hi fuhton ða swyðe, & Israhel ofsloh Og þone cyningc, &his suna, & his folc eall to forwyrde,& geahton his land & ealle his burga.
MOYSES ða ferde to Moab mid ðam folce.
& se cyningc Balac cwæð to his leode: Swa adylegað þisfolc mid heora fyrdcræfte ealle ða ðeeardiað on urum gemærum, swa swa oxa gewunaþ to awestennegærs oð ða wyrtrumanto dældontodældonmidtoðum.
He sende þa his bodan to Balaam ðam witegan, Beores suna& bæd ðæt he come to wyrigenne þæt folcþe fundode wið his, & cwæð: Ic wat þæt se biðgebletsod, ðe ðu gebletsast, & se bið awyrgedþeðu wyrigst.
ða bodan ða comon to Balaan mid sceattum.
Balaam andwyrde þam ærendracum & cwæð: ðeah Balaac mesylle goldes & seolfres an hus full, ic nemæg awendan Godes word.
Ac beoð her to niht & bidað andsware.
ða com God on niht to Balaam, & cwæð: Nu ðas men þefeccað; far mid him, swa ðæt ðu do þæt ic ðebebeode.
Balaam ða ferde forð mid ðam bodum on assan ridende.
& efne Godes encgel forstod þone weg ðær he wolde ridanmid atogenum sweorde, swilce he hineslean wolde.
Se assa geseah ðone encgel standende, & Balaam ne geseah;þa forbeah se assa þæs engles swurd, &eode of ðam wege; Hwæt þa Balaam beot þone assan, woldeðæt he eode innon þone weg.
ða fleah se assa gyt forht for þam encgle, & ðyde hishlafordes fot ðearle to ðam hege; Balaam þagyt beot þone assan.
& se encgel eode in to anum nyrwette, þe he ne mihteforbugan on naðre healfe, for ðan þe þær nanbige næs.
ða feol se assa adune afyrht for ðam engle, & Balaam wearðyrre & beot hine gyt swyðor.
ða geopenode Drihten þæs assan muð, & he cwæð: Hwibeatst ðu me swa swyðe?
& Balaam andwyrde: For ðam ðe ðu me beswice, & ic ðeofslean wolde, gyf ic swurd hæfde.
ða sæde se assa: Ne eom ic na þin assa þe ðu on ridstsymble; Sege hwænne ic æfre ær þyllic ðegebude.
God þa geopenode Balaames eagon, þæt he geseah þone engelþe se assa forbeah, mid nacodum swurde,& he hnah to eorðan, & aleat wið ðæs engles.
& se encgel cwæþ: Hwi beote ðu þinne assan efne nuþrywa?
Ic þe ofsloge sona & se assa ne leofode, gyf he ne forbugeme.
& Balaam cwæð: Ic syngode nytende; nyste þæt ðu stodeongean me, & gyf ðe min færeld mislicað, icfare eft ongean.
Se encgel cwæð to him: Farr mid þisum mannum, & warnaþæt ðu nan þinc elles ne sprece buton þætic þe bebeode; & Balaam þa rad forð.
Se cyning ða, Balac, com him togeanes.
& HE arærde sona seofon weofoda; & þær lac geoffrode onða ealdan wisan.
& cwæð to Balac: Hu mæg ic awyrian þone ðe God bletsode;& he witegode ða, swa him wissode God, &bletsode Israhel.
& Balac cwæð to him: Ic ðe fette for ði, þæt ðu minefynd wyrigdest, & þu hi bletsast.
Balaam cwæð ða: Cwyst ðu, mæg ic oþer sprecan butonðæt Drihten het?
ða cwæð Balac him to: Cum to oðre stowe mid me.
& he eft arærde oðre seofan weofoda, & bletsode Israhel.
& Balac cwæð: Ne ðu hine wyrige, ne ðu hine bletsa.
ða cwæð Balaam to Balaace ðus: Hu ne sæde ic ðe þætswa hwæt swa God me bebude, þæt ic ðæt dyde?
& Balac cwæð: Cum, ic ðe læde to oðre stowe, gyf Godeswa gelicie þæt ðu hi ðanon gewyrige.
Hi eodon ða begen up to ðam munte; & he sona arærdeseofan weofoda, & lac geoffrode.
& ISRAHEL bletsode, & þa ðingc witegode þe him gewissodeGod.
He mihte geseon Israhel of ðam munte þanon.
ða yrsode Balac wið Balaam, & cwæð: Ic ðe het feccan,þæt ðu mine fynd wyrigdest, & þu nu ðrywahi bletsodest.
Far ðe nu ham: ic hæfde gemynt ðe to arwurðienne onæhtum & on feo, ac God ðe benæmde ðæswurðmyntes.

HIT stent on oðrum bocum, þæt Balaam swa ðeah tæhteþam cyningce hu he cuman mihte þæt he hibeswice; & he eac swa dyde; he beswac hi swa, þæt he settewifmen æt his hæðengylde gehende ðamfolce, þær hi on locodon; & hi eodon ða to manega of ðamfolce to ðam myltystrum & wið hi hæmdon; &to ðam hæðengylde bugon.
God wearð ða yrre Israhela bearnum, & het Moyses ahon þaðe ðæt man dydon.
Moyses þa het ða manfullan ofslean, ealle ða ðe bugon toBelphegor.
& þær wurdon ofslagene mid swurdes ecge feower & twentiðusenda of ðæs folces mæniu; & Godes yrregeswac & he him syððan mildsode.
God bebead syþþan Moyse, & cwæð:
Wrec Israhela bearn on ðam Madianitiscum & ofsleaþ hi, forðam þe hi beswicon eow.
MOYSES ða sende sona twelf ðusenda gewæpnodra manna, toðam wige caflice.
& hi ða ferdon & ðæt folc ofslogon, & þone cyningcBalac & Balaam samod; & ðæt land aweston &ða wif heoldon; & comon to Moyse mid micelre huðe.
Moyses ða yrsode; & axode hwi hi heoldon ða wifmen tolife, ðe hi forlærdon ær æt ðamhæðengylde.
& het hi ða acwellan ealle ða wif ðe weras hæfdon.

IOSUE ða sona asende twegen sceaweras digellice of Sathin, &het sceawian ðæt land & ða buruhIericho, hu heo geworht wære; Hi ferdon ða & comon to anremyltistran huse heo wæs Raab gehaten &gereston hi ðær.
ða wearð ðam cyninge gecydd ðæt ðær comon sceaweras ofIsrahela bearnum, ðæt hi ða burhsceawodon, & sende to Raab & het ða sceaweras agyfan.

Ac heo hæfde hi behydd, ær hyre seo hæs to come, on hyreupflora, & geandwyrde ðus: Ic andytteðæt hi comon to me, ac ic ne cuðe heora fær, & hi urnon onæfnunge ut of ðissere byrig, mid ðam ðeða burhgata belocene wurdon; efstaþ nu ardlice & ge hiofridað.
Hi ða sona æfter ridon idelum færelde.
& ðæt wif ða spræc to ðam behyddum werum:
Ic wat nu to soðan ðæt God eow sylð ðisne eard;witodlice eower ege is on us becumen, & ðis folc is geyrged &ormod ongean eow.
We gehyrdon ðæt Drihten adrigde ða Readan Sæ, ða ða geferdon fram Egypta lande, & hu ge ofslogonsyððan twegen cyningas, Seon & Og,
& aswearc ure mod, & ure gast forhtode to eowrum infærelde;eower Drihten is soðlice soð God on heofonum & on eorðan,ðe ealle ðingc gewylt.

Sweriað me nu ðurh Drihten ðæt ge don eft wið me swylcemildheortnysse swa ic macode wið eow, &syllað me sum tacn, ðæt ic sylf beo gehealden, & minfæder, & modor & mine gebroðra & ða ðe us tolociað, alysað fram deaðe.
ða cnihtas hyre andwyrdon & mid aðe hyre beheton: ðonneure Drihten us forgyfð ðisne eard togewealde, we cyðað mildheortnysse on ðe.
Witodlice hire hus wæs on ðam wealle fæst, & heo let hi utmid anum langan rape ðurh ðæs huseseahðirl ofer ðone weal.
& cwæð: Farað eow nu wærlice & gewendað to muntum &lutiað ðær ðry dagas, ðe læs ðe eow gemeton,ða ðe eow æfter ridon, & efstað syððan aweg.

Hi cwædon to ðam wife: We beoð unscyldige wið ðe,ðonne we to ðisum lande becumað, gyf ðu lætstðisne rap hangian on ðam ehðyrle, ðær ðu us ut alete, &gelangast to ðe ðine leofostan frynd,fæder & modor & ðine magas, in to ðe.
& locehwa ut gange, licge he ofslagen, & se ðe on ðam husebeo, hæbbe frið mid ðe.
& gyf ðu abarast ure spræce, we ne beoð forsworene.
ðæt wif him cwæð to: Eower cwyde stande.
Hi efston ða aweg, swa ðæt wif hi lærde, & comon toIosue & cyddon him eal ðis.
Hi sædon him: To soðan us sylð Drihten ðis land; eallesynd geyrgede, ðe eardiað on ðisum lande.
IOSUE ða aras hraðe on ðære nihte, & astyrode his fyrdwicforð to Iordanen, & wicode ðreo nihtwið ða ea on anbidunge.

& sende ða bydelas, & bead eallum ðam here: ðonne maneowres Godes earce styrað mid ðamgangendum bærmannum of Leuies cynne, & ge ne cunnon ðone weg,folgiað eow feorran ðære earce, & nan manne genealæce neah ðam arce.
& beoð gehalgode; betwux eow Drihten wyrcð wundra tomergen.
& he cwæð to ðam sacerdum: Nimað ðis Godes scrin & gaðætforan ðam folce: & ða sacerdas dydon swaswa Iosue hi het.
& Drihten cwæð to Iosue: Nu to dæg ic ongynne ðe tomærsigenne ætforan Israhela bearnum, ðæt himagon witan ðæt ic wille mid ðe beon, swa swa ic mid Moysewæs.
& ðu gewissa ða sacerdas, ða þe ðæt scrin berað, ðæthi gebidon on ðære ea.
Iosue ða clypode, & cwæð to ðam folce:

Be ðam ge magon witan ðæt God wunað betwux eow, & ðahæðenan todræfð, ðe nu habbað ðisne eard on eowregesyhðe, for ðan Iordan, seo ea, ætstent on hyreryne; swa ðæt scrin in bið geboren, swa ofstynt se stream.

ðæt folc ferde ða forð to ðære ea, & sona swa ðabærmen gesetton heora fotlæst on ðære ea ofre,swa ætstod se stream, & ongan to ðindenne ongean, swilcehit wære an heah dun, & se æftra streamarn ut to ðære sæ.
Hwæt ða sacerdas ða ætstodon on ðam grunde on drigremoldan on middan ðære ea, & eal ðæt folcferde forð ofer ða ea be drium grunde.
& DRIHTEN cwæð to Iosue:
Hat nu twelf weras of ðam twelf mægðum niman twelf stanason middan ðære ea ðær ða sacerdas stodon, & habban forðmid eow to eowre wicstowe & wurpan hi ðær.
ða dide Iosue swa swa Drihten him bebead, & cwæð to ðamfolce:
Gyf eowre bearn eow befrinaðeft on uferum dagum, Hwæt doð ðas stanas her?
þonne secge ge to andsware, ðæt seo ea Iordane adruwode,mid ðam ðe ure fæderas ferdon ofer himid ðam halgan scrine, & hi beoð her to gemynde Israhelabearnum a on ecnysse.
ða dydon ða twelf weras swa swa Drihten him bebead, &namon twelf stanas on ðæs streames ryne;hæfdon forð mid him to heora fyrdwicum.
Iosue het eac ahebban oðre twelf stanas tomiddes ðamstreame, þær hi stodon mid ðam scrine, & hiðær ðurhwuniað oð ðisne andweardan dæg.
& ðæt folc ferde forð mid gebylde.
